noun.description: A large trunk or suitcase, typically made of stiff leather and opening into two equal parts.
A word blending the sounds and combining the meanings of two others, for example motel (from motor and hotel) or brunch (from breakfast and lunch)
examples: podcast is a portmanteau, a made-up word coined from a combination of the words iPod and broadcast
a portmanteau word combining smoke and fog

origin: Mid 16th century: from French portemanteau, from porter carry + manteau mantle.
